original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Discharge Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
Acct # :
**ID-NUM
MRN :
**ID-NUM
Admitted :
Discharged :
**DATE[Oct 20 2007]
Dict :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
CHIEF COMPLAINT :
The patient is a **AGE[in 30s]- year - old white male with a known history of Barrett 's esophagus .
He had endoscopy done which documented this back in **DATE[Aug 2007] .
He noted that he was pain free until about a week ago when he noted pain in the chest and nausea and vomiting .
He noted that meat would stick , although would pass when it was able to be swallowed .
He had a stress test at the time which was normal .
EXAMINATION :
The patient 's temperature is 36.4 , pulse 102 , respiratory rate 22 , blood pressure 172/112 .
Lungs clear .
Cardiovascular normal S1 and S2 .
No murmurs , gallops or rubs .
The abdomen is soft .
No palpable hepatosplenomegaly .
No tenderness .
LABS :
Laboratory showed the following :
Troponin was 0.10. Sodium 138 , potassium 3.7 , chloride 99 , bicarb 23.0 , BUN 10 , creatinine 1.1 , glucose 86 , calcium 9.0 , albumin 4.1 , total protein 7.1 , bilirubin total 0.2 , SGPT 102 , SGOT 183 , alkaline phosphatase 96 , lipase 102. Troponin less than 0.10 .
White blood count 6200 , hemoglobin 14.6 , hematocrit 43.6 , platelet count 290,000 .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient was seen by GI .
It was felt by GI that he may have an esophageal stricture .
He will be scoped in the following week .
He also was seen by cardiology .
He had a routine stress test which preliminarily appears negative .
His blood pressure was elevated and he was started on Altace .
He was treated with Zofran and analgesia .
He was discharged to be followed up by his primary care provider .
MEDICATIONS :
Were the following :
1. Altace 5 mg p.o. daily .
2. Protonix 40 mg p.o. b.i.d.
3. Lexapro 10 mg p.o. daily .
4. Albuterol p.r.n. nebulizer .
5. Advair 250/50 1 puff b.i.d.
6. Vicodin 5 mg 1 tab p.o. q. 6 hours p.r.n. severe pain , 20 were dispensed .
7. Compazine 10 mg p.o. q. 6 hours p.r.n. nausea and vomiting .
DIET :
Should be as tolerated .
He is advised a soft diet .
DIAGNOSES :
1. Gastroesophageal reflux disease .
2. Barrett 's esophagitis .
3. History of tobacco use , chewing tobacco .
4. Hypertension .
5. Abnormal liver function tests .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS :
He is to have a set of liver function tests and hepatitis screening and a lipid panel drawn before discharge .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW XXX] , MD
HS Job # 849993 / 41855 /
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Oct 20 2007] 15:39
T :
**DATE[Oct 22 2007] 04:10
**CARBON-COPY
